definition: to go (of car, train etc)/to drive off

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: When we got to the railway station, the train had left.
sentences.chinese: 我们到火车站时，火车已经开走了。

sentences.english: He ran to the station only to find the train had left.
sentences.chinese: 他跑到火车站却发现火车已开走。

sentences.english: She stared towards them and they ran to his car and sped off.
sentences.chinese: 她紧盯着他们，他们俩吓得赶紧跑进车开走了。

sentences.english: Before I got to the bus stop, the bus had already left.
sentences.chinese: 到了公交车站前，汽车已经开走了。

sentences.english: You've missed the bus, it just went by.
sentences.chinese: 你错过了公共汽车，它刚开走。

sentences.english: I had hardly entered the station before the last train left.
sentences.chinese: 我刚一到车站最后一班火车就开走了。

sentences.english: I sent the Willys to find out if the major's alive.
sentences.chinese: 我看着威利斯开走去找那个少校，希望他还活着。

sentences.english: Soon we heard the sound of the lorry revving up and moving off.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿，我们听到了卡车起动和开走的声音。

sentences.english: When ZhangHui got to the railway station yesterday morning, the train had already left.
sentences.chinese: 张辉赶到火车站时，火车已经开走了。

sentences.english: Check your rear-view mirror before you drive away.
sentences.chinese: 开走之前先看看后视镜。

sentences.english: The last bus having gone，we had to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 末班公共汽车已开走了，我们只好走路回家。

sentences.english: A great screaming, and then, slip away.
sentences.chinese: 接着一声尖叫，然后滑至一边开走。

sentences.english: She ran to the station only to find that the train had left.
sentences.chinese: 她跑到火车站，但火车却开走了。

sentences.english: When the cars vanished, the street was open its entire length and width.
sentences.chinese: 车子都开走后，整个街道都露了出来。

sentences.english: I crossed the motorway and watched as he drove off.
sentences.chinese: 我穿过了高速公路，看着他开走了。

sentences.english: The train which left just now is going to Sichuan Prov.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚开走的那列火车是开往四川的。

definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to tow/towed vehicle/towing vehicle
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
to drag away
police car
van for carrying people/taxi minibus
taxi/(Tw) rental car
fare/transport costs
traffic/to drive (i.e. travel in a vehicle)
car-related business/car dealership/taxi company/(commercial) garage
to leave port/to put off
chauffeur/driver/CL:個|个[ge4]
small model car/mini-car/small horse-cart/barrow/wheelbarrow/type of folk dance
